definitions: reality or actual state of a matter as opposed to falsehood
fundamental philosophical concept concerning the correspondence between belief and reality
quality of being sincere, honest, or authentic in expression
examples: She finally discovered the truth about her family's history
The court demanded nothing but the truth from witnesses
Philosophers have debated the nature of truth for millennia
Different cultures hold varying perspectives on absolute truth
There was undeniable truth in his emotional confession
Speaking your truth requires courage and vulnerability

definitions: thickened underground stem or root that stores nutrients for plants
edible underground plant part commonly used as food source
examples: The potato is technically a tuber rather than a root
Botanists studied how tubers store energy during dormancy
Sweet potato tubers provide essential nutrients in many diets
Farmers harvested tubers before the first frost arrived

definitions: English royal dynasty ruling from 1485 to 1603 including Henry VIII
distinctive architectural style characterized by timber framing and decorative chimneys from Tudor period
examples: The Tudor period witnessed England's break from the Catholic Church
Henry VIII was the most famous Tudor monarch
Their house featured classic Tudor revival architecture with exposed beams
Tudor style buildings dominate the historic district downtown

definitions: third day of the week following Monday and preceding Wednesday
examples: The committee meets every Tuesday at noon sharp
Tuesday's election results surprised political analysts nationwide

definitions: North African nation bordered by Algeria, Libya, and the Mediterranean Sea
examples: Tunisia gained independence from France in nineteen fifty-six
Tourists flock to Tunisia's Mediterranean beaches every summer

definitions: citizen or native inhabitant of the North African country Tunisia
characteristic of or relating to Tunisia, its culture, or language
examples: Many Tunisians speak both Arabic and French fluently
The Tunisian artist exhibited her work in Paris
Tunisian cuisine features Mediterranean and North African influences
They studied Tunisian Arabic at the language institute

definitions: Alan Turing, British mathematician and computer scientist who developed foundational computing theories
examples: The Turing machine concept laid foundations for modern computing
Turing's work at Bletchley Park helped defeat Nazi Germany

definitions: person from Turkey or of Turkish ethnic descent
member of various Turkic peoples historically from Central Asia
examples: Young Turks revolutionized Ottoman politics in the early twentieth century
Many Turks migrated to Germany for work opportunities
The Seljuk Turks conquered much of Anatolia in medieval times
Ottoman Turks built an empire spanning three continents

definitions: transcontinental country located mainly on Anatolian Peninsula bridging Europe and Asia
large domesticated or wild bird native to North America traditionally eaten at Thanksgiving
theatrical production, movie, or project that fails completely
examples: Turkey joined NATO in nineteen fifty-two during the Cold War
Istanbul serves as Turkey's cultural and economic center
Wild turkeys can actually fly despite their hefty size
The Thanksgiving turkey weighed twenty pounds this year
That expensive movie turned out to be a complete turkey
Critics called the Broadway show a turkey after opening night

definitions: relating to group of languages spoken across Central Asia and Eastern Europe
examples: Turkic languages share similar grammatical structures despite geographic separation
Scholars study ancient Turkic inscriptions found in Mongolia

definitions: official language of Turkey belonging to the Turkic language family
characteristic of Turkey, its people, culture, or customs
examples: She studied Turkish for three years before visiting Istanbul
Turkish uses a modified Latin alphabet since nineteen twenty-eight
Turkish coffee is served thick and strong in small cups
The restaurant specialized in authentic Turkish cuisine

definitions: landlocked country in Central Asia bordered by Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Afghanistan, and Iran
examples: Turkmenistan possesses the world's fourth largest natural gas reserves
The capital of Turkmenistan is Ashgabat with its marble buildings

definitions: characteristic of Tuscany region in central Italy or its people
simplest classical architectural order with unfluted columns and plain capitals
examples: Tuscan wine regions produce some of Italy's finest vintages
The villa showcased traditional Tuscan countryside architecture
The building featured Tuscan columns supporting the front portico
Tuscan order represents the most basic Roman column style

definitions: region in central Italy known for art, wine, and Renaissance heritage
examples: Florence serves as the capital city of Tuscany region
Tourists explore Tuscany's rolling hills and medieval villages yearly

definitions: ancient Egyptian pharaoh whose intact tomb was discovered in 1922 by Howard Carter
examples: Tutankhamun's golden death mask became an iconic archaeological treasure
King Tutankhamun died mysteriously at approximately nineteen years old

definitions: ethnic group primarily found in Rwanda and Burundi in East Africa
examples: The Tutsi people traditionally worked as cattle herders historically
Tensions between Tutsi and Hutu populations sparked tragic conflicts

definitions: short frilled skirt worn by ballet dancers during performances
Desmond Tutu, South African Anglican archbishop and anti-apartheid activist
examples: The ballerina's pink tutu sparkled under the stage lights
She practiced pirouettes wearing her new performance tutu
Archbishop Tutu received the Nobel Peace Prize in nineteen eighty-four
Desmond Tutu fought tirelessly against South African apartheid

definitions: small island nation in Pacific Ocean threatened by rising sea levels
examples: Tuvalu faces existential threats from climate change effects
The population of Tuvalu numbers fewer than twelve thousand people

definitions: one of two children born from same pregnancy at same time
one of a matching or identical pair of objects or things
examples: The twins celebrated their birthday with separate parties this year
Identical twins share exactly the same genetic material
The twin towers dominated the city skyline before their destruction
She bought twin beds for the guest bedroom

definitions: online social networking service for sharing short messages called tweets
series of short high-pitched sounds made by small birds
examples: Twitter transformed how people share news and opinions globally
The company announced their new product launch on Twitter
Morning birdsong filled the air with cheerful twitter sounds
Sparrows twitter constantly outside my bedroom window

definitions: river in northeast England flowing through Newcastle to the North Sea
examples: Newcastle and Gateshead face each other across the River Tyne
Historic bridges span the Tyne connecting both river banks

definitions: rubber covering fitted around wheel rim providing traction and cushioning
ancient Phoenician city in modern Lebanon known for purple dye production
examples: The car needed new tyres before the long journey
Winter tyres provide better grip on icy roads
Ancient Tyre dominated Mediterranean trade for many centuries
Alexander the Great besieged Tyre for seven months

definitions: any aerial phenomenon that cannot be immediately identified or explained
examples: The pilot reported seeing a UFO during the night flight
Government agencies investigated numerous UFO sightings last year

definitions: ultra high frequency radio waves between 300 megahertz and 3 gigahertz
examples: Television broadcasts originally used UHF channels for local stations
Emergency services communicate using UHF radio frequencies

definitions: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization promoting international cooperation
examples: UNESCO designated the site as a World Heritage location
The organization works through UNESCO to preserve cultural artifacts

definitions: United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund providing humanitarian aid to children
examples: UNICEF delivers vaccines to children in developing nations worldwide
The charity partnered with UNICEF for clean water projects

definitions: multiuser computer operating system developed at Bell Labs in the 1970s
examples: Many servers still run various versions of Unix today
Linux descended from Unix design principles and philosophy

definitions: Uniform Resource Locator specifying the location of resources on the internet
examples: Copy the URL from your browser's address bar carefully
Each webpage has its own unique URL identifier

definitions: abbreviated form of United States of America, the North American federal republic
examples: Athletes competed for USA in the Olympic Games
The package shipped from USA arrived within five days

definitions: United States Air Force, the aerial warfare service branch of American military
examples: USAF pilots train at bases across the southern states
The USAF operates advanced fighter jets and transport aircraft

definitions: United States Department of Agriculture overseeing farming, forestry, and food
examples: USDA inspectors ensure meat products meet safety standards nationwide
Farmers receive USDA subsidies during difficult harvest years

definitions: United States Marine Corps, amphibious warfare branch of American military forces
examples: USMC forces specialize in rapid deployment amphibious operations worldwide
The USMC motto 'Semper Fidelis' means always faithful

definitions: United States Navy, the maritime warfare service branch of American military
examples: USN vessels patrol international waters maintaining freedom of navigation
The USN operates aircraft carriers around the globe

definitions: Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, communist state existing from 1922 to 1991
examples: The USSR collapsed in nineteen ninety-one ending the Cold War
Space race competition between USA and USSR drove technological advances

definitions: Coordinated Universal Time, primary time standard regulating clocks and time worldwide
examples: International flights display arrival times in UTC format
Computer systems synchronize using UTC to avoid timezone confusion

definitions: landlocked country in East Africa bordered by Kenya, Tanzania, Rwanda, and Congo
examples: Uganda gained independence from Britain in nineteen sixty-two
Mountain gorillas attract tourists to Uganda's national parks

definitions: citizen or native inhabitant of the East African country Uganda
characteristic of or relating to Uganda, its people, or culture
examples: Many Ugandans speak both English and local languages fluently
The Ugandan athlete won gold at the Commonwealth Games
Ugandan coffee ranks among the world's finest arabica varieties
They studied Ugandan traditional music at the cultural center

definitions: Turkic ethnic group native to Xinjiang region in northwest China
Turkic language spoken by the Uighur people in Central Asia
examples: Uighur culture blends Central Asian and Islamic traditions uniquely
International organizations monitor Uighur human rights situations closely
She studied Uighur script at the linguistics department
Uighur uses modified Arabic alphabet for written communication

definitions: large country in Eastern Europe bordered by Russia, Poland, Romania, and Black Sea
examples: Ukraine declared independence from Soviet Union in nineteen ninety-one
Agricultural exports from Ukraine feed millions globally each year

definitions: citizen or native inhabitant of the Eastern European country Ukraine
East Slavic language spoken primarily in Ukraine using Cyrillic script
characteristic of or relating to Ukraine, its people, or culture
examples: Many Ukrainians emigrated to Canada in the early twentieth century
The Ukrainian programmer developed innovative software solutions
Ukrainian uses Cyrillic alphabet with some unique letters
Students enrolled in Ukrainian language classes at university
Ukrainian folk music features distinctive bandura instrument sounds
The restaurant served traditional Ukrainian borscht soup

definitions: northernmost province of Ireland comprising six counties forming Northern Ireland
heavy double-breasted overcoat with cape originally from Ulster region
examples: Ulster remains politically divided between unionist and nationalist communities
Belfast serves as the largest city in Ulster province
He wore a traditional Ulster coat against the winter cold
The Victorian Ulster featured a distinctive shoulder cape

definitions: major Islamic caliphate dynasty ruling from 661 to 750 CE from Damascus
examples: The Umayyad Caliphate expanded Islamic rule to Spain and Central Asia
Umayyad architecture includes the Great Mosque of Damascus

definitions: global community of Islamic believers bound together by religious faith
examples: The concept of ummah transcends national and ethnic boundaries
Muslims consider themselves part of one unified ummah worldwide

definitions: organized association of workers formed to protect rights and interests
act or state of joining or being joined together into one
political unit formed by joining states, provinces, or territories together
examples: The labor union negotiated better wages for factory workers
Teachers joined the union to secure healthcare benefits
Their union produced three children and lasted fifty years
The union of these companies created a powerful corporation
The European Union facilitates trade between member nations
The Soviet Union dissolved into independent republics

definitions: member of Christian denomination rejecting Trinity doctrine believing in God's unity
relating to or characteristic of Unitarian religious beliefs and practices
examples: Many Unitarians embrace progressive social justice causes actively
The Unitarian minister welcomed people of all faiths
Unitarian theology emphasizes reason and individual spiritual exploration
Their Unitarian congregation practices inclusive worship services

definitions: Christian theological movement rejecting Trinity and emphasizing God's singular nature
examples: Unitarianism developed from Protestant Reformation theological debates historically
Modern Unitarianism embraces religious pluralism and social justice

definitions: ancient Sanskrit texts containing central philosophical concepts of Hinduism
examples: The Upanishads explore the nature of reality and consciousness
Students studied Upanishad teachings about Brahman and Atman

definitions: language family including Finnish, Hungarian, Estonian and related languages
examples: Uralic languages spread across northern Eurasia from Scandinavia to Siberia
Linguists trace Uralic languages to common prehistoric origins

definitions: Indo-Aryan language spoken primarily in Pakistan and northern India
examples: Urdu serves as Pakistan's national language alongside English
Beautiful Urdu poetry traditions span several centuries historically

definitions: small country in South America bordered by Brazil, Argentina, and Atlantic Ocean
examples: Uruguay pioneered progressive social policies in Latin America
Montevideo serves as Uruguay's capital and largest city
